page.title: 14WORSBROUGH VILLAGE
page.content: The oldest residential part of the district of Worsbrough is{Worsbrough {Village}.It is competely separate from the rest of Worsbrough both geographically and architecturally.It stands at the top of a steep wooded hillside.It was in saxon times called{Wircesburg}and was a fortified settlement.Since that time the spelling has changed many times.For many years the name was spelt "{Worsborough}",and many older people still refer to it as such.The name was officially changed on 1st February 1956 to the present spelling of {Worsbrough}.This was done at the instigation of Mr.A.O.Elmhirst whose reseach showed the word{Brough}to mean a fortified settlement which is what Worsbrough originally was.
